title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, February 13, 1869
summary: Continuing an earlier complaint about a black preacher in Staunton, Scott argues, "I dont believe there is, or has been a case of parallel obstinacy on the part of the colored people anywhere in the south, with this here on the part of the minister and two or three others who want to teach." Scott proposes to build an annex to the Methodist church to be used as a schoolroom. [Image of school building depicted at the top of the letter. The following descriptive remarks surround the image: End of Church, Proposed School Room, Basement we use, Bank not excavated.]
keywords: African Americans, Education, Church/Religious Activity, Race Relations, Economy, American Civil War
